thread.title: Selby seeks Stateside mark in title defence
thread.title_full: Selby seeks Stateside mark in title defence - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Selby seeks Stateside mark in title defence
text:
LOS ANGELES: Welshman Lee Selby will be out to impress US fight fans when he puts his International Boxing Federation featherweight world title on the line in Arizona on Wednesday. 

"I want to fight the top guys and I think if I get a big win and look good here, I'll be in the mix," Selby said as he looked ahead to his fight with former three-division champion Fernando Montiel of Mexico. 

Selby won the IBF featherweight belt in May, dethroning Evgeny Gradovich by technical decision after the bout was stopped in the eighth round because of a cut from a head butt over the Russian's right eye. 

Selby led on all three scorecards, with one judge awarding him every round. He took his record to 21-1 with eight knockouts, his only defeat coming in his fifth pro bout in 2009. 

Selby is particularly interested in a future fight against Leon Santa Cruz. 

He was ringside when Santa Cruz, a former bantamweight and junior featherweight title holder won a majority decision and vacant world title against Abner Mares on August 29. 

First he'll have to get past the 36-year-old Montiel, whose record of 54-4-2 with 39 knockouts includes eight victories in a row at junior feather and featherweight. 

"I honestly believe that he chose the wrong guy to fight," said Montiel, who expects strong support at the Gila River Arena in suburban Glendale. 

"I've won in hostile crowds before, so it won't be a problem," said Selby, adding that he's looking forward to a tough test. 

"I'm really excited," he said. "This is my first world title defence and it's against a tough challenge that most guys wouldn't take. It's not an easy win. 

"If I beat a guy like him and look good, it should raise my profile overnight."
